title.narrative: Advocacy on victims´ rights and peace processes implementation - extension 2022

description.narrative: State institutions have become more accountable to civil society, communities, victims and partners. Human rights defenders, including themselves and the 265 member organizations, have been protected and are able to maintain the scope and the reach of their work because of more favourable public policies. Civil society and in particular victims are able to influence the peace process and take part in the implementation of the peace accords at national level and in the regions, ensuring truth, justice, reparation and guarantees of non-repetition. Change in behavior of executive, judicial, legislative branches and independent control bodies in relation to human rights violations and justice for crimes (this includes behavior of institutions set up to implement the peace accords). More effective protection measures at individual level or at public policy level. Legal and administrative framework is in place to ensure the implementation of the peace accords. Peace accords are implemented.

Strengthen pedagogical action and social mobilization in favour of peace and strengthen leadership to demand accountability measures for victims. Conduct national and international advocacy and campaigning in favour of the rights of victims. Engage in the implementation of the peace agreement, in particular around the search and identification of the remains of disappeared people. Strengthen the capacities of human rights defenders to claim their right to be protected, raise their profiles and enhance the legitimacy of their work. Promote effective public policies to protect human right defenders. Strengthen member organizations´ participation in the implementation of the peace accords, especially around mechanisms related to forced disappearances and the truth commission. Support member organizations in prioritizing cases of strategic litigation considering the legal framework for the Special Peace Tribunals. Use international human rights mechanisms, including UN system and EU instruments, to promote the rights of victims.
